Package oshi.json.hardware.impl

Class HardwareAbstractionLayerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • oshi.json.json.AbstractOshiJsonObject
      • oshi.json.hardware.impl.HardwareAbstractionLayerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, HardwareAbstractionLayer, OshiJsonObject
    public class HardwareAbstractionLayerImpl
extends AbstractOshiJsonObject
implements HardwareAbstractionLayer
    Wrapper class to implement HardwareAbstractionLayer interface with platform-specific objects
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getUsbDevices

        public UsbDevice[] getUsbDevices​(boolean tree)
        Instantiates an array of UsbDevice objects, representing devices connected via a usb port (including internal devices). If the value of tree is true, the top level devices returned from this method are the USB Controllers; connected hubs and devices in its device tree share that controller's bandwidth. If the value of tree is false, USB devices (not controllers) are listed in a single flat array. In the JSON output, this parameter may be specified by the "hardware.usbDevices.tree" property value.
        Specified by:
        getUsbDevices in interface HardwareAbstractionLayer
        Parameters:
        tree - WHether to display devices in a nested tree format from their controllers
        Returns:
        An array of UsbDevice objects representing (optionally) the USB Controllers and devices connected to them, or an empty array if none are present

      • getSoundCards

        public SoundCard[] getSoundCards()
        Instantiates an array of SoundCard objects, representing the Sound cards.
        Specified by:
        getSoundCards in interface HardwareAbstractionLayer
        Returns:
        An array of SoundCard objects or an empty array if none are present.

      • toJSON

        public javax.json.JsonObject toJSON​(java.util.Properties properties)
        Returns this object as a JsonObject. The provided properties will be set on this object to configure the type of information returned using this and future invocations of OshiJsonObject.toJSON().
        Specified by:
        toJSON in interface OshiJsonObject
        Parameters:
        properties - Properties to configure returned results
        Returns:
        a JsonObject for this class.
